description: Wonder Weeks spurt and leap content data

4.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 1)
behavior: Sleep and feeds feel less predictable
tips: Feeding: quiet, low-stim feeds
Sleep: short soothing, swaddle/white noise
Communication: soft voice, skin-to-skin

5.title: Leap 1: Changing Sensations
tips: Feeding: may feed more often for comfort
Sleep: keep environment calm and consistent
Communication: talk and sing to your baby more

7.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 2)
tips: Feeding: be patient with changing patterns
Sleep: maintain consistent routines
Communication: provide extra comfort and reassurance

8.title: Leap 2: Patterns
behavior: May be fussier as brain develops
skills: Begins to notice patterns in daily routines
tips: Feeding: establish regular feeding patterns
Sleep: create consistent bedtime routines
Communication: point out patterns in daily life

9.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 3)
tips: Feeding: may want to feed more frequently
Sleep: be patient with sleep disruptions
Communication: provide varied sensory experiences

11.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 3 continued)
tips: Feeding: maintain patience with feeding changes
Sleep: stick to routines despite disruptions
Communication: introduce new activities and toys

12.title: Leap 3: Smooth Transitions
behavior: May be fussy as skills develop
tips: Feeding: may show more interest in feeding process
Sleep: movements may disturb sleep initially
Communication: encourage reaching and grasping

15.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 4)
tips: Feeding: may be distracted during feeds
Sleep: may fight sleep more
Communication: provide varied activities

16.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 4 continued)
tips: Feeding: create calm feeding environment
Sleep: maintain consistent sleep routines
Communication: offer comfort and patience

17.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 4 continued)
tips: Feeding: be flexible with feeding times
Sleep: extra comfort may be needed
Communication: provide lots of reassurance

18.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 4 final)
behavior: Final fussy period before major leap
Shows signs of major development coming
tips: Feeding: maintain patience and flexibility
Sleep: prepare for potential sleep changes
Communication: extra cuddles and comfort

19.title: Leap 4: Events
tips: Feeding: may show preferences for foods
Sleep: bedtime routines become more important
Communication: play peek-a-boo and interactive games

24.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 5)
tips: Feeding: may be distracted by surroundings
Sleep: may resist sleep due to excitement
Communication: provide safe exploration opportunities

25.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 5 continued)
tips: Feeding: create distraction-free feeding space
Sleep: maintain consistent routines
Communication: stay close during exploration

26.title: Leap 5: Relationships
tips: Feeding: may want to self-feed
Sleep: separation anxiety may affect sleep
Communication: encourage social interaction

35.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 6)
tips: Feeding: encourage self-feeding attempts
Sleep: may resist bedtime routines
Communication: balance independence with safety

36.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 6 continued)
tips: Feeding: be patient with messy eating
Sleep: maintain firm but gentle boundaries
Communication: redirect rather than restrict

37.title: Leap 6: Categories
tips: Feeding: may categorize foods by preference
Sleep: understands bedtime routine sequence
Communication: name categories and groups

43.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 7)
tips: Feeding: encourage self-feeding with finger foods
Sleep: may resist sleep due to activity
Communication: acknowledge feelings and offer choices

44.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 7 continued)
behavior: May be defiant or testing boundaries
tips: Feeding: offer variety and let them choose
Sleep: maintain consistent boundaries
Communication: use simple choices and clear limits

45.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 7 final)
tips: Feeding: be patient with food exploration
Sleep: prepare for potential sleep regression
Communication: encourage problem-solving attempts

46.title: Leap 7: Sequences
tips: Feeding: can follow mealtime sequences
Sleep: understands bedtime routine order
Communication: explain sequences and next steps

52.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 8)
tips: Feeding: may be very particular about food
Sleep: may have vivid dreams affecting sleep
Communication: explain the world around them

53.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 8 continued)
behavior: May be anxious about new situations
tips: Feeding: maintain patience with food preferences
Sleep: provide extra comfort and security
Communication: answer questions and provide reassurance

54.title: Fussy phase (pre-Leap 8 final)
tips: Feeding: respect their growing autonomy
Sleep: maintain consistent comfort routines
Communication: validate their complex feelings

55.title: Leap 8: Programs
tips: Feeding: can participate in meal planning
Sleep: understands sleep importance
Communication: engage in complex conversations
